Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little-master cup; interior, from outside: black wall; band of alternate red and black tongues between sets of three narrow black bands; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of prancing deer (part of red neck, shoulder and part of forelegs remaining) to right; exterior glazed black with reserved band on lower wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 43, pl. XXI, no. 53)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 419, no. B654)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1340) (phase 3)
